contents.description: Meet with Core Location engineers to discuss how you can leverage features of the Core Location framework in your app. Get details and advice on best practices for providing location-based features in a power efficient and privacy conscious manner.
contents.title: Core Location Lab

contents.description: The Speech Recognition API allows you to perform rapid and contextually informed speech recognition in both file-based and realtime scenarios. Get one-on-one technical guidance from Apple engineers about using speech recognition in your apps. Bring your code and your questions.
contents.title: Speech Recognition Lab

contents.description:
Learn how you can put your apps at the top of relevant search results and get details on implementing Search Ads.

Appointment requests are accepted starting at 7:00 a.m. for that day only. Appointments are recommended, but not required — you may drop in anytime during these hours.
contents.title: Search Ads By Appointment Lab

contents.description: WWDC 2018 Keynote
contents.title: WWDC 2018 Keynote

contents.description: Meet the engineers creating the technologies to configure, deploy, and manage Apple devices in business and education.  If you're building apps for education, SysAdmin deploying macOS, iOS and tvOS in your environment, this lab will help answer questions and guide you through the process. Learn best practices for integrating custom apps in your IT environment, development and deployment considerations for environments using Apple School Manager, SchoolWork, and Classroom, and the latest techniques for distributing apps and Apple hardware.
contents.title: Apple Device Management Lab

contents.description: Metal provides powerful tools for debugging shaders and optimizing performance. Bring your project and get expert recommendations and troubleshooting guidance from the Metal engineers.
contents.title: Metal Debugging and Profiling Lab

contents.description: Network with the community of game designers, developers, and Apple experts. Engage in conversations about key topics driving game development on Apple platforms. Connect with others who share your interests and play award-winning games from your favorite genres across iOS, tvOS, and macOS.
contents.title: Games Get-Together

contents.description: Getting content to Apple Watch and having it ready to go goes a long way for making a quick and actionable experience. We have a team of expert engineers ready to work with you on finding the best path to success for how and when you can get your data and update your app's UI. Bring your code to us and we can help you pin down a great architecture to keep your app up to date.
contents.title: watchOS Runtime and Connectivity Lab

contents.description: Explore the many ways that apps can be accessible and inclusive to everyone. Find out about the great work being done in accessibility for entertainment, education, art and design, productivity, and more. Ask questions, share experiences, and envision new possibilities together.
contents.title: Accessible Technology and Inclusive Design Get-Together

contents.description: Receive expert assistance and tips from Apple's Core Motion engineers to elevate your app's awareness of movement.
contents.title: Core Motion Lab

contents.description:
Get help with App Store Connect and features like TestFlight, Sales and Trends, and App Analytics. Receive guidance on responding to customer reviews, offering subscriptions, setting up in-app purchases, uploading builds, in-app purchase receipts, using altool and Transporter, and more.

Appointment requests are accepted starting at 7:00 a.m. for that day only. Appointments are recommended, but not required — you may drop in anytime during these hours.
contents.title: App Store Connect By Appointment Lab

contents.description: Augmented reality can transform how you work, learn, play, and connect with almost everything around you. See how AR is used creatively in learning and get hands-on with a broad range of compelling AR apps and games. Meet others who share your interests and learn more about the capabilities of ARKit. This is a great opportunity to make new connections, spark your curiosity, share your ideas, and be inspired.
contents.title: AR Get-Together

contents.description: Siri Shortcuts are a powerful new feature in iOS 12 that allow your app to expose its functionality to Siri. This enables Siri to suggest your shortcut at relevant times based on various context. Shortcuts can also be added to Siri to run with a voice phrase on iOS, HomePod and watchOS. Learn how to expose shortcuts in your app using NSUserActivity and discover the benefits of creating custom intents with SiriKit for a richer user experience.
contents.title: Introduction to Siri Shortcuts

contents.description: Prepare your app for a global audience. Apple engineers working on internationalization technologies and localization tools will be available to answer your questions, and help you along every step of the way to make your app world-ready. If you have code-level questions bring your project and we'll work with you one-on-one to resolve bugs and answer questions. If you are just getting started, come to get advice on preparing your app for international markets.
contents.title: Internationalization Lab

contents.description:
Receive guidance on choosing the right business model for your app, pricing strategies, discoverability, launch planning, marketing, engaging your users, making the most of your product page, and localizing your app to reach users around the world. Bring any information that will help us assist you, such as a demo of your app or business and marketing plans.

Appointment requests are accepted starting at 7:00 a.m. for that day only. Appointments are recommended, but not required — you may drop in anytime during these hours. Business and Marketing appointments are limited to one per person for the duration of the conference.
contents.title: Business and Marketing By Appointment Lab

contents.description: Prepare your app for a global audience. Apple engineers working on internationalization technologies and localization tools will be available to answer your questions, and help you along every step of the way to make your app world-ready. If you have code-level questions bring your project and we'll work with you one-on-one to resolve bugs and answer questions. If you are just getting started, come to get advice on preparing your app for international markets.
contents.title: Internationalization Lab

contents.description: Leverage the abilities of TextKit to provide the best experience possible displaying and editing text. Get the best performance out of your app by using TextKit effectively. Learn the concepts to do more complex handling, layout and presentation.
contents.title: TextKit Best Practices

contents.description: Talk with Apple's expert Bluetooth engineers and learn how to improve the throughput and reliability of your Bluetooth accessories.  Discuss how your app can best use Core Bluetooth to communicate with a Bluetooth Low Energy device.
contents.title: Bluetooth Lab

contents.description: Universal Scene Description (USD) enables the robust description of 3D scenes and empowers engineers and artists to seamlessly collaborate across the creative workflow.  Receive hands-on technical guidance and development advice from USD experts and the Model I/O engineering team. Bring your code and your questions.
contents.title: USD and Model I/O Lab

contents.description:
Get advice on making your apps simple to use and visually compelling in a consultation with an Apple designer. Come prepared with a working prototype, development build, or your released app.

Appointments are 30 minutes each and are assigned by random selection. You can submit a request from 7:00-7:30 a.m. each morning, and you’ll get an email letting you know whether you received an appointment for that day shortly after 7:30 a.m. If you do not receive an appointment, you can submit a request again on another day. Appointments are limited to one per developer for the duration of the conference.
contents.title: User Interface Design By Appointment Lab

contents.description: Get all of your Core Image questions answered by the very team responsible for this rich macOS and iOS framework. The engineers on-hand will be happy to work with you on solving performance challenges you may face in your app, as well as brainstorm on creative ways that Core Image can be applied to create effects or solve the imaging tasks that you face. Bring your code!
contents.title: Core Image Lab

contents.description:
Get help with updating your developer account, managing your development devices and certificates, renewing your membership, and more. Be sure to have your Apple ID, Team ID, and any related information that will help us assist you.

Appointment requests are accepted starting at 7:00 a.m. for that day only. Appointments are recommended, but not required — you may drop in anytime during these hours.
contents.title: Apple Developer Program Support By Appointment Lab

contents.description: Every app uses collections! Go beyond the basics with specific tips on how best to use indices, slices, bridging, laziness, and reference types. Gain better understanding of when to use each collection for best performance.
contents.title: Using Collections Effectively

contents.description:
Find out what is required for your apps to comply with the U.S. Export Regulations for encryption and get details on how Apple reviews apps that use encryption technologies.

Appointment requests are accepted starting at 7:00 a.m. for that day only. Appointments are recommended, but not required — you may drop in anytime during these hours.
contents.title: Export Compliance By Appointment Lab

contents.description: Meet with the Maps and Location engineers to discuss how you can embed new MapKit JS maps on your website and integrate MapKit and CoreLocation framework APIs in your app. Get details and advice on native and web map features and best practices for providing location-based features in a power efficient and privacy conscious manner.
contents.title: Mapping and Location Technologies Lab

contents.description: iOS 12 enhances the Cocoa Touch frameworks to improve app performance and deliver exciting new features. Learn about performance best practices, security improvements, tools for supporting multiple screen sizes and shapes, new APIs for iMessage apps, Siri Shortcuts, and Swift refinements. Find out which sessions you won't want to miss throughout the week.
contents.title: What's New in Cocoa Touch

contents.description: UNICEF works in more than 190 countries and territories to put children first and has helped save more children’s lives than any other humanitarian organization. Today, UNICEF is leveraging real-time data and emerging technologies to not only protect children’s lives and rights but also empower them to drive change in their own communities. Rajesh Anandan, founder of UNICEF USA’s Ventures group, will share insights from innovative youth empowerment programs from Kampala to Kathmandu to Klamath Falls, including UNICEF Kid Power, which launched the world’s first Wearable-for-Good® that was named one of Time’s 25 Best Inventions.
contents.title: Unleashing the Power of Kids

contents.description: The UIKit framework team will be on hand to answer questions you have using Cocoa Touch with your App. This lab has a focus on UIKit performance so get advice from Apple's top experts and identify opportunities for a performance gain in your user interface. There will also be engineers on hand to help you with other UIKit classes like view controllers, scroll views, and gesture recognizers in your apps.
contents.title: UIKit and Performance Lab

contents.description: SiriKit allows for a rich interaction between the user, your app, and Siri. Siri Shortcuts now extend these intents by allowing you to do much more to surface your app's functionality throughout the system. Team up with one of our Siri engineers and work through your SiriKit and shortcuts questions. We'd love to help you leave WWDC with better SiriKit code, helpful shortcuts guidance, and ideas to take home.
contents.title: Siri Shortcuts and SiriKit Lab

contents.description: Stop by during Open Hours to talk with Apple engineers about things you learned during the week, to get answers to questions about new technologies you're experimenting with, or to find a fix for a difficult bug.
contents.title: Xcode Open Hours

contents.description: Using Core ML models in Vision makes the creation of powerful Computer Vision applications easy. Learn how easy it is to use custom trained classifiers and object recognition models in a live camera capture. In addition, you'll learn about the latest additions to the Vision Framework along with a deeper dive into some its fundamentals.
contents.title: Vision with Core ML

contents.description: Meet with the CarPlay team to get expert answers on supporting CarPlay in your audio, navigation, messaging, VoIP calling, or automaker app. Bring your code and be prepared to demo and fix bugs in real time as you engage with the engineers that work on CarPlay. If you've never looked at supporting CarPlay, this is a perfect opportunity to get advice. If you develop CarPlay hardware, bring your questions to the CarPlay engineering team.
contents.title: CarPlay Lab

contents.description: Visit with the CallKit and Identity Lookup engineering teams to get expert technical guidance for integrating VoIP calls with the system with CallKit, blocking and identifying calls with Call Directory, filtering SMS messages with Message Filtering, and reporting junk communications with Unwanted Communication Reporting.
contents.title: CallKit and Identity Lookup Lab

contents.description: Get expert help on how to use Auto Layout in your apps. Bring your code and talk with Interface Builder, Cocoa, and Cocoa Touch engineers on how to optimally structure your user interface.
contents.title: Auto Layout and Interface Builder Lab

contents.description: Learn how to use assets to bring visually compelling and data efficient artwork to your apps, leveraging new features in iOS 12. Gain insight into organizing, optimizing, and authoring artwork assets by using asset catalogs to their fullest. Learn techniques to better streamline workflows between designers and developers. Ensure better app delivery and a smaller footprint, maximizing target audiences of your app with full artwork asset fidelity.
contents.title: Optimizing App Assets

contents.description: Discover how memory graphs can be used to get a close up look at what is contributing to an app’s memory footprint. Understand the true memory cost of an image. Learn some tips and tricks for reducing the memory footprint of an app.
contents.title: iOS Memory Deep Dive

contents.description: Join Apple engineering teams as they answer your questions about Swift. Whether you're just getting started, you're working on perfecting your protocols, or you just want to chat with someone who loves conditional conformances as much as you do, we'd love to talk with you.
contents.title: Swift Open Hours

contents.description: Apps on tvOS entertain, inform, and inspire with their content and interactive experiences. tvOS 12 brings new technologies that help make these experiences even more enjoyable and engaging. Get an introduction to focus engine support for non-UIKit apps, new UI elements, and Password AutoFill. Learn how to bring it all together to create incredible tvOS apps and experiences.
contents.title: What's New in tvOS 12

contents.description: Learn how to use debugging tools like Instruments, LLDB, and memory graphs to track down problems in your app. Get hands-on help analyzing your app with tools like the Address Sanitizer and Thread Sanitizer. Bring your project to have our engineers help with advanced profiling and bulletproofing your app.
contents.title: Profiling and Debugging Lab

contents.description: watchOS 5 brings web content to Apple Watch by rendering rich HTML in Messages and Mail. Gain insights into how watchOS maintains compatibility with existing web content, and find out what you can do to optimize your web content for Apple Watch.
contents.title: Designing Web Content for watchOS

contents.description: SceneKit is a fast and fully featured high-level 3D graphics framework that enables your apps and games to create immersive scenes and effects. Learn more about physically-based rendering, get started with ARKit integration, and get tips from the SceneKit engineering team. Bring your work-in-progress and get your questions answered.
contents.title: SceneKit Lab

contents.description:
Reserve time in our fully outfitted studio to record the latest episode of your audio podcast, right here at WWDC. Each 60 minute session can accommodate up to four contributors, with Apple experts on hand to help get your session up and running. You will receive a copy of your session for post-production and distribution.

Appointment requests are accepted starting at 7:00 a.m. for that day only. Apple Podcasts Studio appointments are limited to one per person for the duration of the conference.
contents.title: Apple Podcasts Studio

contents.description: Bring your C, Objective-C, and C++ questions to discuss with the LLVM teams. Work out issues you're having building and linking C language code.
contents.title: LLVM Compiler, Objective-C, and C++ Lab

contents.description: Now that you can update the contents in real-time, dynamically change the action buttons, and include lots of interactivity within the notification, it's time to leave text-only notifications behind. Work side by side with our engineering team and learn how you can turn your existing notifications into interactive, actionable experiences. Just bring your questions, thoughts, and code.
contents.title: WatchKit and watchOS Notifications Lab

contents.description: A great app is an efficient app, whether you’re talking about power or performance. Meet and talk with Apple engineers about how to optimize and tune your application to make it stand out from the pack!
contents.title: Power and Performance Lab

contents.description: iOS, macOS, watchOS and tvOS offer a rich set APIs for recording, processing, and playing back audio in your apps. Additionally, Audio Unit Extensions let you add sophisticated audio manipulation and processing capabilities to host apps. Get one-on-one technical guidance from Apple engineers about using Audio APIs and Audio Unit Extensions. Bring your code and your questions.
contents.title: Audio Lab

contents.description: StoreKit Engineers and App Store Operations members will answer your questions about in-app purchases, receipt validation, subscription infrastructure, the sandbox environment, and server-side logic.
contents.title: StoreKit / Subscriptions Lab

contents.description: Apple File System is now the default filesystem across all Apple operating systems for all Apple devices. Talk to the engineers on the team and learn how to optimize your applications for Apple File System.
contents.title: Apple File System Lab

contents.description: The tvOS SDK allows you to create and build amazing apps and games for the big screen. And with TVMLKit you can easily and quickly develop native tvOS apps with XML templates and JavaScript logic. Get one-on-one technical guidance from Apple engineers about your own apps. Bring your code and your questions.
contents.title: tvOS Lab

contents.description: Learn about the latest updates in StoreKit, including offering introductory pricing for subscriptions, requesting ratings and reviews, promoting your in-app purchases within the App Store, and developing in the sandbox environment. Dive deep into best practices for processing transactions and validating receipts.
contents.title: Best Practices and What’s New with In-App Purchases

contents.description: Get one-on-one technical guidance from Apple Camera engineers about all aspects of camera capture and photo access on iOS devices. Come prepared with your code and demos to get expert advice on fixing bugs, optimizing performance, and create great camera experiences in your app.
contents.title: AVCapture Lab

contents.description: Are your apps designed and implemented to protect the personal information of your users? Meet Apple’s Privacy engineering team, for answers and expert guidance.
contents.title: Privacy Lab

Get advice on making your apps simple to use and visually compelling in a consultation with an Apple designer. Come prepared with a working prototype, development build, or your released app.

contents.description: Meet with members of the App Store Connect, TestFlight, and App Store API teams for expert guidance on App Analytics, in-app purchase, subscriptions and meta-data optimization techniques for publishing your apps on the App Store. Bring your questions about how best to integrate with your in-house tooling to automate loading information into App Store Connect, manage your testing workflows, and deliver your binary.
contents.title: App Store and App Store Connect Lab

contents.description: Talk with Apple engineers about how to create a build and test strategy using Unit and UI Testing, testing with Simulator, or how to set up workflows using Xcode Server. Bring your code and your questions.
contents.title: Simulator, Testing, and Continuous Integration Lab

contents.description: Metal Performance Shaders (MPS) includes a highly tuned library of machine learning primitives that leverage the tremendous power of the GPU. Meet the MPS engineering team and get your questions answered about training CNNs and RNNs.
contents.title: Metal for Machine Learning Lab

contents.description: Stop by during Open Hours to talk with Apple engineers about things you learned during the week, to get answers to questions about new technologies you're experimenting with, or to find a fix for a difficult bug.

contents.description: Bring your C, Objective-C, and C++ questions to discuss with the LLVM teams. Work out issues you're having building and linking C language code.

contents.description: Talk with Apple engineers about how to create a build and test strategy using Unit and UI Testing, testing with Simulator, or how to set up workflows using Xcode Server. Bring your code and your questions.
contents.title: Simulator, Testing, and Continuous Integration Lab

contents.description: Meet the Accelerate engineering team to get expert advice on handling large-scale mathematical computations and optimal image processing in your apps. The Accelerate framework and the associated simd library provide a vast array of advanced APIs that can help you achieve incredible performance in iOS, macOS, tvOS, and watchOS.
contents.title: Accelerate Lab

contents.description: Engage in discussions about healthcare, fitness, wellness, and research, as well as related Apple technologies such as HealthKit, ResearchKit, and CareKit. This is a great opportunity to share your iOS, tvOS, and watchOS app experiences, network, and brainstorm new solutions together.
contents.title: Health, Fitness, and Research Get-Together

contents.description: Join Apple engineering teams as they answer your questions about Swift. Whether you're just getting started, you're working on perfecting your protocols, or you just want to chat with someone who loves conditional conformances as much as you do, we'd love to talk with you.
contents.title: Swift Open Hours

contents.description: Stop by during Open Hours to talk with Apple engineers about things you learned during the week, to get answers to questions about new technologies you're experimenting with, or to find a fix for a difficult bug.

contents.description: Metal Performance Shaders (MPS) includes a highly tuned library of machine learning primitives leveraging the tremendous power of the GPU. With iOS 12 and macOS Mojave, MPS adds capabilities to accelerate the computationally intensive task of training a neural network. Learn performance optimizations for inference, and understand the training process for both convolutional and recurrent neural networks (CNNs and RNNs).
contents.title: Metal for Accelerating Machine Learning

Find out how to make your apps accessible and easy to use for everyone. Learn the basics of VoiceOver and other accessibility features to better understand how customers with varying needs use your products. Come prepared with a working prototype, development build, or your released app.

contents.description: Testing is an essential tool to consistently verify your code works correctly, but often your code has dependencies that are out of your control. Discover techniques for making hard-to-test code testable on Apple platforms using XCTest. Learn a variety of tips for writing higher-quality tests that run fast and require less maintenance.
contents.title: Testing Tips & Tricks

contents.description: Core Data is a framework that manages object graphs, relationships, and persistence of those objects. Apple engineers will be on hand to answer questions about Core Data and how it reduces the amount of code you have to write to manage your model. We're here to help you get answers, learn about the latest development techniques and tools, and improve your code and apps.
contents.title: Core Data Lab

contents.description: Bring your app and your questions about code signing and packaging apps. Whether you're working through a problem, or you just want a better understanding of how certificates and profiles work, you'll find Apple engineers who are eager to help.
contents.title: Signing and Distribution Lab

contents.description: Meet the engineers creating the technologies to configure, deploy, and manage Apple devices in business and education.  If you're building apps for education, SysAdmin deploying macOS, iOS and tvOS in your environment, this lab will help answer questions and guide you through the process. Learn best practices for integrating custom apps in your IT environment, development and deployment considerations for environments using Apple School Manager, SchoolWork, and Classroom, and the latest techniques for distributing apps and Apple hardware.

contents.title: Building Your App with Xcode 10 Lab

contents.description: Vision is a high-level framework that provides an easy to use API for handling many computer vision tasks. We'll dive deep into a particularly powerful feature of Vision—tracking objects in video streams. Learn best practices for using Vision in your app. Gain a greater understanding of how request handlers function in terms of lifecycle, performance, and memory utilization.
contents.title: Object Tracking in Vision

contents.description: Tracking workouts with Apple Watch is popular with fitness professionals and novices alike.  See how the new workout API streamlines the entire lifecycle of a workout, complete with ability to restart a session after a crash to prevent you from losing data. Learn how the new workout classes, types, and queries provide quick access to baseline sample data you would typical calculate without limiting access to the fine grained samples you may occasionally require.
contents.title: New Ways to Work with Workouts

Receive guidance on choosing the right business model for your app, pricing strategies, discoverability, launch planning, marketing, engaging your users, making the most of your product page, and localizing your app to reach users around the world. contents.title: ARKit Lab

contents.description: The LLVM suite of compiler tools in Xcode 10 have new language features, improved diagnostics, and more powerful optimizations. Find out about improvements to ARC for Objective-C, keep up with the newest additions to C++, get an overview of new and improved diagnostics and static analyzer checks, and learn about how LLVM compiler technology is delivering faster build times and better runtime performance for your apps.
contents.title: What's New in LLVM

contents.description: Hear about the latest advancements in Swift, the safe, fast, and expressive language. Find out about improvements to build times, code size, and runtime performance. Learn how to take advantage of new features in your code that eliminate boilerplate, increase safety and security, and improve your overall development productivity.
contents.title: What's New in Swift

contents.description: Generics are one of the most powerful features of Swift, enabling you to write flexible, reusable components while maintaining static type information. Learn about the design of Swift's generics, including how to generalize protocols, leverage protocol inheritance to express the varying capabilities of related types, build composable generic components with conditional conformances, and reason about the interaction between class inheritance and generics.
contents.title: Swift Generics

contents.description: Siri Shortcuts are a great way to help people execute actions or get information from your app, but shortcuts can be made even more powerful by adding them to Siri to be used with a simple phrase. Learn how you can now customize responses from Siri and add custom UI to make a great shortcuts experience across iOS, watchOS and HomePod. See how to allow users to add and manage shortcuts from right within your app and learn best practices to make shortcut suggestions that can be exposed through Settings.
contents.title: Building for Voice with Siri Shortcuts

contents.description: Apple Bug Reporter is a web-based tool that developers can use to report issues with Apple software and services, request enhancements to APIs and tools, and track the status of their feedback. Talk to the teams that build and maintain Bug Reporter and get tips for filing helpful and actionable bug reports. By including logs, sample projects, screen shots, and more, you can help your bugs get to the right team at Apple.
contents.title: Bug Reporter Lab

contents.description: Ground-up coverage of how to make an app that can fit on devices of every size and shape. Make your app fit beautifully on Apple's full range of devices with the minimum amount of effort, future-proofing your user experience along the way.
contents.title: UIKit: Apps for Every Size and Shape

contents.description: Realize the full potential of your Metal-based games by tackling common issues that cause frame rate slowdowns, stutters, and stalls. Discover how to clear up jitter and maintain a silky-smooth frame rate with simple changes in frame pacing. Get introduced to new tools for analyzing rendering passes and pinpoint expensive or unexpected work. Learn how to avoid thread stalls and get specific advice about handling thermal notifications.
contents.title: Metal Game Performance Optimization

contents.description: Meet the Vision framework engineering team and discuss how you can add object tracking, face detection, barcode detection, custom Core ML models, and more to your apps. Bring your code and share a demo of what you're working on. The experts on hand will be happy to answer your questions, debug performance concerns, and explore creative opportunities with you.
contents.title: Vision Lab

contents.description: Experience incredible music, food, and drinks at Discovery Meadow, just steps away from the McEnery Convention Center. Attendees 21 years and older may drink alcohol and can pick up a wristband for drinks on Thursday either on the plaza outside McEnery Convention Center or at the tent inside Discovery Meadow by showing their valid government-issued photo ID. Bag check is not available at the bash, so please leave your bags at the hotel.
contents.title: Bash

contents.description: Bring your questions about adopting Document Browser in your app. Talk to the Quicklook Preview team about how to implement Quicklook to preview documents inside your app. Get hands-on support from a cross-functional team of Apple engineers behind file providers, UIDocument, file coordination, and the other technologies involved in Document Management.
contents.title: Document Browser, Quick Look Previews, and File Providers Lab

contents.description: Engineers from Apple’s Security team will be on hand to answer your questions and give you expert advice on all aspects of security: protecting data on device, in transit, cryptography, authorization and authentication, and the new security features in macOS.
contents.title: Security Lab

contents.description: Core Image is the essential framework for handling image processing tasks in your photo and video apps. In this session, we'll explore new additions to the framework that allow you to achieve great performance in your filter chains and custom CIKernels. We'll also demo a new approach to prototyping in Core Image through the use of an interactive Python environment. Through these techniques you'll discover new ideas for building new creative effects as well as practical approaches to batch processing images for tasks such as image compositing and data boosting for machine learning.
contents.title: Core Image: Performance, Prototyping, and Python

contents.description: Use Apple's accessibility APIs to deliver a seamless experience for a broad range of users. Whether you are working with VoiceOver, hearing aids, speech synthesis, or other accessibility features, be prepared to demo and fix issues in real time as you meet with Apple engineers. If you are just getting started, this is a perfect opportunity to get advice on making your app usable by everybody, regardless of their abilities.
contents.title: Accessibility Lab

contents.description:
Get advice on making your apps simple to use and visually compelling in a consultation with an Apple designer. Come prepared with a working prototype, development build, or your released app.

Appointments are 30 minutes each and are assigned by random selection. You can submit a request from 7:00-7:30 a.m. each morning, and you’ll get an email letting you know whether you received an appointment for that day shortly after 7:30 a.m. If you do not receive an appointment, you can submit a request again on another day. Appointments are limited to one per developer for the duration of the conference.
contents.title: User Interface Design By Appointment Lab

contents.description: Meet with the Natural Language engineering team who will be ready to answer all your questions and discuss your ideas for leveraging natural language processing in your apps. Dive deeper into the new possibilities available to you through the use of custom Core ML models for word tagging and text analysis. Bring your code!
contents.title: Natural Language Lab

contents.description: Join us for an unforgettable award ceremony celebrating developers and their outstanding work. The 2018 Apple Design Awards recognize state of the art iOS, macOS, watchOS, and tvOS apps that reflect excellence in design and innovation.
contents.title: Apple Design Awards

contents.description: The TrueDepth camera in the iPhone X streams high-quality depth data in real time allowing you to enhance your photo and video apps in fun and creative ways. Dive deep into the principles and best practices for working with depth data, learn how to use the new Portrait Segmentation API for still images, and see how these techniques can create special effects like background replacement and perspective changes.
contents.title: Creating Photo and Video Effects Using Depth

contents.description: Xcode integrates with GitHub, Bitbucket, and GitLab to help you manage your source code, back up your files, and collaborate with others. Find out how to easily see the changes in your project right in the source editor, and learn how to use Xcode for common source control workflows with Git. See how conflicts occur, how to resolve them, and how to avoid them before they even happen.
contents.title: Source Control Workflows in Xcode

contents.description: Meet with the Maps and Location engineers to discuss how you can embed new MapKit JS maps on your website and integrate MapKit and CoreLocation framework APIs in your app. Get details and advice on native and web map features and best practices for providing location-based features in a power efficient and privacy conscious manner.
contents.title: Mapping and Location Technologies Lab

contents.description: Podcasts reach millions of listeners around the world every year, and Podcast Analytics help you understand your listening audience. Meet the engineering team behind the Apple Podcasts app and get your questions answered on how to achieve the best success with your own podcast using Podcast Analytics.
contents.title: Apple Podcasts Lab

contents.description: Safari and WebKit are continually evolving with new features, APIs, and cutting edge web standards. Learn about this year’s biggest feature highlights, designed to help you create richer experiences with better performance and security — whether you are developing content for a browser or developing an app with embedded web content.
contents.title: What’s New in Safari and WebKit

contents.description: A great app is an efficient app, whether you’re talking about power or performance. Meet and talk with Apple engineers about how to optimize and tune your application to make it stand out from the pack!
contents.title: Power and Performance Lab

contents.description: Local and push notifications enable your app to keep users informed with timely and relevant content, by displaying messages and accepting users’ actions, or playing distinctive sounds, or updating the badge on your app icon. Improvements to rich notifications help you create more engaging content and better manage notifications. Find out what’s new and get expert advice on implementing user notifications in your app.
contents.title: What’s New in User Notifications

contents.description: Natural Language is a redesigned framework designed to provide high-performance, on-device APIs for fundamental NLP tasks across all Apple platforms. Through the deep integration of the framework with Core ML and Create ML, you now have the ability to train custom NLP models to perform many different inferences and leverage the power of NLP in your apps. Join us for this exciting session to learn all the details and to see it in action.
contents.title: Introducing Natural Language Framework

contents.description: Discover advanced techniques, and tips and tricks for enhancing your Xcode debugging workflows. Learn how to take advantage of LLDB and custom breakpoints for more powerful debugging. Get the most out of Xcode’s view debugging tools to solve UI issues in your app more efficiently.
contents.title: Advanced Debugging with Xcode and LLDB

contents.description: ARKit provides a cutting-edge platform for developing augmented reality (AR) apps for iPhone and iPad. Get expert tips and advice from ARKit engineers and designers about world tracking, face tracking, object detection, and more. Bring your questions or work-in-progress.
contents.title: ARKit Lab

contents.description: Well-executed typography is essential to good user interface design. Meet with Apple engineers to learn how to best use Text Kit or Core Text in your apps. Get advice on achieving complex text layouts, and learn how to use text and fonts to create compelling interfaces.
contents.title: Text and Fonts Lab

contents.description:
Open to all women and advocates for women, these informal breakfast get-togethers are a great way to meet the phenomenal community of women at WWDC and enjoy a breakfast buffet and coffee to start your day.

Join us for an engaging panel discussion with female WWDC scholarship winners, moderated by Adele Peterson, Apple Engineering Manager of Mail and Co-Chair of Women@Apple.
contents.title: Women@WWDC Breakfasts

contents.description: Discover the techniques used to create the fluid and dynamic interfaces of iOS and other Apple platforms. Learn how to design gestures and animations that feel intuitive and natural and will make your app delightful.
contents.title: Designing Fluid Interfaces

contents.description:
Learn how apps can be considered for potential promotional opportunities on Apple.com, Apple Retail Stores, Channel, and Broadcast.

Appointment requests are accepted starting at 7:00 a.m. for that day only. Appointments are recommended, but not required — you may drop in anytime during these hours. Apple Marketing Communications appointments are limited to one per person for the duration of the conference.
contents.title: Apple Marketing Communications By Appointment Lab

contents.description: Apple engineers will be on hand to review your code and answer questions about HealthKit, workouts, CareKit and ResearchKit. Any technical, code-based, or session follow-up question are fair game so don't be shy. We're here to answer your questions, help you learn about the latest development techniques and tools, and improve your code and apps.
contents.title: Health and Fitness Technologies Lab

contents.description: On macOS, Metal 2 adds specialized support for virtual reality (VR) rendering and external GPUs. Learn about new features and optimizations to take advantage of these technologies within your Metal 2-based apps and games. Understand best practices for scheduling workloads across multiple GPUs and techniques for frame pacing while multi-threading.
contents.title: Metal for VR

contents.description:
Open to all women and advocates for women, these informal breakfast get-togethers are a great way to meet the phenomenal community of women at WWDC and enjoy a breakfast buffet and coffee to start your day.

The morning kicks off with Christie Smith, Apple’s Vice President of Inclusion & Diversity, leading a conversation on intersectionality and identity in the workplace, culminating in the activity “You in Six Words.”
contents.title: Women@WWDC Breakfasts

contents.description: Metal Performance Shaders (MPS) harnesses the massive parallelism of the GPU to dramatically accelerate calculations at the heart of modern ray tracing and ray casting techniques. See how ray tracing can provide greater realism in 3D scenes through improved shading, soft shadows, and global illumination. Understand how MPS accelerates ray-triangle intersections while enabling dynamic scene updates, and learn how to extend your app across multiple GPUs for even greater performance.
contents.title: Metal for Ray Tracing Acceleration

contents.description:
Learn how apps can be considered for potential promotional opportunities on Apple.com, Apple Retail Stores, Channel, and Broadcast.

Appointment requests are accepted starting at 7:00 a.m. for that day only. Appointments are recommended, but not required — you may drop in anytime during these hours. Apple Marketing Communications appointments are limited to one per person for the duration of the conference.
contents.title: Apple Marketing Communications By Appointment Lab

contents.description: Go hands-on with the Game Controller framework and get expert technical guidance for integrating with a MFi game controller and the Siri Remote. Bring your code and your questions.
contents.title: Game Controllers Lab

contents.description: Great app experiences leap off the screen. They are dynamic, immersive, personal, and, above all else, the result of a strong and clear intent. Learn key techniques for being intentional with your design by choosing appropriate metaphors, making extreme choices, and making every interaction feel more authentic and natural.
contents.title: Intentional Design

contents.description: Search Ads is a great way to help people discover your app in App Store search results. Learn how new market expansion will give you greater opportunities to reach high quality customers. See how Search Ads Advanced new creative variations will help make your app promotion even more effective.
contents.title: What's New in Search Ads

contents.description: Get one-on-one technical guidance from Apple Camera engineers about all aspects of camera capture and photo access on iOS devices. Come prepared with your code and demos to get expert advice on solving issues, optimizing performance, and create great camera experiences in your app.
contents.title: AVCapture Lab

contents.description:
Open to all women and advocates for women, these informal breakfast get-togethers are a great way to meet the phenomenal community of women at WWDC and enjoy a breakfast buffet and coffee to start your day.

Join us as Kim Azzarelli, CEO & Co-founder of Seneca Women and Chair of Cornell’s Center for Women, Justice, Economy & Technology chats with Esther Hare, Senior Director of Worldwide Developer Marketing and Executive sponsor of Women@Apple, about new myths that hold women back in the workplace.
contents.title: Women@WWDC Breakfasts

contents.description: Go beyond borders. Meet developers and Apple employees from China, India, Southeast Asia, Latin America, Middle East, Russia, Turkey, and Africa. Check out some of the best local apps and find out how to expand your app business into more countries. Ask questions about language, culture, infrastructure and region-centric design and come away with a plan to get your app into the hands of new customers.
contents.title: Apps for the World Get-Together

contents.description: Meet one-on-one with the Foundation engineers to get answers to your questions about archiving, date and time calculations, internationalization, operating system utilities, core collection types, preferences, and more. Bring your code and your questions.
contents.title: Foundation Lab

contents.description: Learn the best practices for architecting your subscription infrastructure using StoreKit and server-side logic. Find out about simple engineering techniques to keep your subscribers longer, and how to utilize new tools and APIs to give your subscribers the best experience.
contents.title: Engineering Subscriptions

contents.description: With complications, Siri Shortcuts, and Watch apps, there are increasing opportunities to surface meaningful and relevant information and actions to your users on Apple Watch. Prepare your questions, open your project, and sit with our team of experts on all things Apple Watch to dive into your code line by line to find the right solution.
contents.title: WatchKit, ClockKit, and Siri Shortcuts Lab

contents.description: Check out the capabilities of ReplayKit 2 for live screen broadcasting and see how to access its rich functionality right from Control Center. Meet the ReplayKit engineering team to receive hands-on technical guidance. Bring your code and get your questions answered.
contents.title: ReplayKit Lab

contents.description:
Find out how to make your apps accessible and easy to use for everyone. Learn the basics of VoiceOver and other accessibility features to better understand how customers with varying needs use your products. Come prepared with a working prototype, development build, or your released app.

Appointments are 30 minutes each and are assigned by random selection. You can submit a request from 7:00-7:30 a.m. each morning, and you’ll get an email letting you know whether you received an appointment for that day shortly after 7:30 a.m. If you do not receive an appointment, you can submit a request again on another day. Appointments are limited to one per developer for the duration of the conference.
contents.title: Accessibility Design By Appointment Lab

contents.description: Learn about new management capabilities for iOS, macOS, and tvOS, tool evolution over the past year, and important changes coming this fall. You'll discover how new MDM features help administrators manage devices more effectively, how educators can enhance the classroom learning environment, and how app developers can make their app a better fit for education and enterprise customers.
contents.title: What's New in Managing Apple Devices

contents.description: Developed by Apple, SwiftShot is an energetic and immersive multiplayer AR game built with key iOS technologies. Glimpse behind the curtain and see how SwiftShot was designed and developed using ARKit, SceneKit, and Swift. Understand the intricacies of designing great gameplay for AR, and learn practical techniques for multiplayer synchronization and physics simulation.
contents.title: Inside SwiftShot: Creating an AR Game

contents.description: The localization process in Xcode 10 has been updated to aid you through the lifecycle of exporting, importing, and testing localized content in your apps. See new functionality added in Xcode 10 and learn how the new localization catalog helps you build world-class, localized apps.
contents.title: New Localization Workflows in Xcode 10

contents.description: Sudden app crashes are a source of bad user experience and app review rejections. Learn how crash logs can be analyzed, what information they contain and how to diagnose the causes of crashes, including hard-to-reproduce memory corruptions and multithreading issues.
contents.title: Understanding Crashes and Crash Logs

contents.description: AirPlay allows you to wirelessly stream content from your iOS device or Mac to AirPlay-enabled speakers, HomePod or an Apple TV. And with AirPlay 2, you can now fill the home with multi-room audio. Learn best practices, and get one-on-one development advice and technical assistance directly from the AirPlay engineering team. Bring your code and your questions.
contents.title: AirPlay Lab

contents.description: Get hands-on guidance and practical recommendations to move your OpenGL-based apps and games to Metal. Meet the engineering team and get your questions answered about essential concepts behind Metal, its low-overhead architecture, and streamlined API.
contents.title: OpenGL to Metal Porting Lab

contents.description: Learn how to use sophisticated Signal and Image Processing techniques to bring higher performance to your apps while lowering battery consumption.  See compelling use cases for the Accelerate framework with interactive demos. Explore using simd—a valuable addition that effortlessly brings vector programming to your apps.
contents.title: Using Accelerate and simd

contents.description: Do you have an idea for an app that you think would be useful to others, but you don't know how to make it a reality? You're not alone! Lots of people are interested in app development, but they aren't sure how to turn their idea to code and then into a finished app. From first steps to Xcode, we'll explain the building blocks you need to turn your iOS app idea into reality.
contents.title: I Have This Idea For An App...

contents.description: Whether it's for UI elements or a fundamental part of your application, at some point, you have to handle images. This session is packed with engaging insight into how images are handled in iOS including discussion of UIImage, UIImageView, custom drawing in UIKit, plus advanced CPU and GPU techniques that can help you maximize performance and minimize memory footprint.
contents.title: Image and Graphics Best Practices

contents.description: AppKit and Foundation are some of the building blocks for your macOS apps. Bring your laptop and your code and work with Apple engineers to resolve your AppKit and Foundation issues and answer your questions.
contents.title: Cocoa Lab

contents.description: Metal 2 is Apple-designed graphics software that lets developers build console‑style games. Learn key aspects of the Metal architecture that support the techniques for modern high-performance game rendering. See how Metal now enables the GPU to schedule work for itself, allowing complete scenes and compute workloads to be built and executed with little to no CPU interaction. Understand how the seamless integration of Metal 2 with the A11 Bionic chip lets your apps and games realize entirely new levels of performance and capability.
contents.title: Metal for Game Developers

contents.description: Get a glimpse inside to find out what happens when you add a constraint! Dive into the internals of Auto Layout to develop intuition for how your code affects what happens under the hood. Learn how to measure and refine your approach to Auto Layout and see how its improved performance in iOS 12 will speed up your app.
contents.title: High Performance Auto Layout

contents.description: watchOS 5 makes creating great experiences on Apple Watch easier than ever before. Learn about robust capabilities to create rich and interactive notifications, a new background mode and controls for audio playback, shortcuts that bring your apps to the Siri watch face, and more. See what’s new in watchOS and discover how to expand your app’s presence on the wrist.
contents.title: What's New in watchOS

contents.description: Build your apps faster in Xcode 10. Learn how to structure your projects and tweak your code to take full advantage of all processor cores. Whether you've made a few small code changes you want to give a try, or you're building your full app for release, these techniques will cut the time it takes to build a running app.
contents.title: Building Faster in Xcode

contents.description: All apps benefit from a focus on performance and an increase in overall responsiveness. This information packed session gives you strategies for fixing performance problems using Instruments and other tools. Additionally, get practical advice based on experience in tuning Apple's own apps including Xcode and Photos on iOS.
contents.title: Practical Approaches to Great App Performance

contents.description: Sarah Parcak is an archaeologist specializing in the use of satellite images to map the world's ancient treasures. Using high-res satellite and drone imagery, she uses subtle variations in the Earth’s surface as a clue to potential hidden man-made features beneath.  Winner of the 2016 TED Prize, Sarah will discuss the online citizen science platform she has recently launched to “protect the world’s hidden heritage” as well as some of her most recent stunning findings.
contents.title: Mapping Archaeology from Space

contents.description:
Learn how apps can be considered for potential promotional opportunities on Apple.com, Apple Retail Stores, Channel, and Broadcast.

Appointment requests are accepted starting at 7:00 a.m. for that day only. Appointments are recommended, but not required — you may drop in anytime during these hours. Apple Marketing Communications appointments are limited to one per person for the duration of the conference.
contents.title: Apple Marketing Communications By Appointment Lab

contents.description: Accessories extend your Apple device and make it possible to connect it to the world around you.  Bring your accessories and your technical questions to Apple's AirPlay, Thunderbolt, Lightning and USB engineers.
contents.title: Accessories Lab

contents.description: The UIKit framework team will be on hand to answer questions you have using Cocoa Touch with your App. This lab has a focus on UIKit drag and drop. Apple Engineers will be on hand to help you with other UIKit classes like view controllers, scroll views, and gesture recognizers in your apps. The more prepared you are as you come to this lab, the better.
contents.title: UIKit and Drag and Drop Lab

contents.description: When you imagine building a new app, what do you think about? Models, views, and controllers deserve their prominent place in the design process, but we don't often give the same attention to the underlying work our apps need to do. Understand how to identify and optimize the algorithms in your app, and discover how implementing algorithms as generic protocol extensions results in efficient, effective, and maintainable code.
contents.title: Embracing Algorithms

contents.description: UICollectionView is a flexible, powerful tool to help you achieve great user experiences in your applications. Hear how you can leverage these rich APIs to rapidly move from initial design ideas to polished shipping applications. Topics range from getting started to advanced update animations and layouts.
contents.title: A Tour of UICollectionView

contents.description: Learn how to update your audio or navigation app to support CarPlay. Apps in CarPlay are optimized for use in the car, and automatically adapt to available vehicle screens and input controls. Audio apps can deliver music, news, podcasts, and more. With the new CarPlay framework, Navigation apps can provide detailed maps, destination search, turn-by-turn guidance, and user notifications.
contents.title: CarPlay Audio and Navigation Apps

contents.description: People expect long battery life on their mobile devices, and apps play a vital role in achieving that experience. Understand how app behavior affects battery consumption, and learn strategies to conserve energy while providing the best experience for your app. Find out how Xcode Energy Reports can help you tune your app to use the least amount of power possible.
contents.title: What’s New in Energy Debugging

contents.description: HTTP Live Streaming enables the reliable delivery of audio and video over a wide variety of network conditions, and FairPlay Streaming secures the transport of your content. Learn best practices, and get one-on-one technical guidance from Apple engineers about using these technologies in your apps. Bring your code and your questions.
contents.title: HTTP Live Streaming Lab

contents.description: Swift Playgrounds is a revolutionary iPad app to teach coding with the powerful Swift programming language. Learn how to create your own content for Swift Playgrounds using the new template, and find out how to use the subscription format to host your own feed online for others to access.
contents.title: Create Your Own Swift Playgrounds Subscription

contents.description:
Get help with App Store Connect and features like TestFlight, Sales and Trends, and App Analytics. Receive guidance on responding to customer reviews, offering subscriptions, setting up in-app purchases, uploading builds, in-app purchase receipts, using altool and Transporter, and more.

Appointment requests are accepted starting at 7:00 a.m. for that day only. Appointments are recommended, but not required — you may drop in anytime during these hours.
contents.title: App Store Connect By Appointment Lab

contents.description: Celebrate WWDC with a one-of-a-kind run through San Jose with the coaches from Nike Run Club. Bring your favorite running shoes, your iPhone or Apple Watch with the Nike Run Club app installed, and a pair of headphones to participate in the fun. Check-in opens at 6:30am for a 7:00am start.
contents.title: WWDC Run with Nike Run Club

contents.description: The new ClassKit framework lets you organize educational content in your app so that teachers can discover and assign specific activities and view students’ progress in the new Schoolwork app. Learn how to adopt ClassKit to your content structure, declare assignable content, and share student progress on activities teachers assign in Schoolwork.
contents.title: Introducing ClassKit

contents.description: Get expert help on how to use Auto Layout in your apps. Bring your code and talk with Interface Builder, Cocoa, and Cocoa Touch engineers on how to optimally structure your user interface.
contents.title: Auto Layout and Interface Builder Lab

contents.description: Meet with Apple engineers to discuss how you can leverage the ClassKit APIs in your app. Get details and advice on surfacing your app's rich curriculum for use in Schoolwork, how to deep link to assignments and best practices for communicating activity and progress to educators using your app in class.
contents.title: ClassKit and Education Technologies Lab

contents.description: Enjoy live music, a selection of local beers, and the company of fellow developers. Attendees 21 years and older will need to present their valid government-issued photo ID to drink alcohol.
contents.title: Music on the Plaza

contents.description: Ever wonder what happens when you build your project in Xcode? Learn how Xcode automates the steps required to build an application, and go behind the scenes to learn how clang, swiftc, and the linker work together to turn your source code into a working program.
contents.title: Behind the Scenes of the Xcode Build Process

contents.description:
Find out how to make your apps accessible and easy to use for everyone. Learn the basics of VoiceOver and other accessibility features to better understand how customers with varying needs use your products. Come prepared with a working prototype, development build, or your released app.

Appointments are 30 minutes each and are assigned by random selection. You can submit a request from 7:00-7:30 a.m. each morning, and you’ll get an email letting you know whether you received an appointment for that day shortly after 7:30 a.m. If you do not receive an appointment, you can submit a request again on another day. Appointments are limited to one per developer for the duration of the conference.
contents.title: Accessibility Design By Appointment Lab

contents.description: Talk with CloudKit engineers to understand how you can leverage the CloudKit APIs in your app and on your website. Get advice on how to model your data, save and query records, subscribe to updates, create custom record zones, and share your records with other users. Talk to Apple experts about how to make the most of all the iCloud technologies. Bring all your CloudKit and iCloud questions, your laptop, and your code.
contents.title: iCloud and CloudKit Lab

contents.description: App Store Connect is constantly evolving to improve the experience of managing and deploying your app on App Store. Learn about the new App Store Connect API for managing frequently modified data such as users and groups, see the latest updates to Sales Trends and Analytics reporting, and TestFlight features enhanced to help you test and deploy your next masterpiece.
contents.title: What's New in App Store Connect

contents.description: Xcode 10 brings the ability for you to create custom instruments. Grab some time with an Apple engineer to find out how to best use signposts in your app, build a custom instrument of your own, and get your questions answered about the CLIPS language.
contents.title: Custom Instruments Lab

contents.description: Learn how to use debugging tools like Instruments, LLDB, and memory graphs to track down problems in your app. Get hands-on help analyzing your app with tools like the Address Sanitizer and Thread Sanitizer. Bring your project to have our engineers help with advanced profiling and bulletproofing your app.
contents.title: Profiling and Debugging Lab

contents.description: Learn how to build playgrounds and content to teach coding concepts with Swift Playgrounds. Team up with an engineer from the Swift Playgrounds team to create a subscription feed for your playground.
contents.title: Creating Content for Swift Playgrounds Lab

contents.description: Confounded by a crash? Bring it to the lab and get expert help tracking it down. Whether a bad instruction, a bad memory access, or your app just ate some bad food, the Apple engineers on hand will work with you to find out why.
contents.title: Crash Logs Lab

contents.description: Danielle Feinberg has had a remarkable career at Pixar Animation Studios where, as Director of Photography for Lighting, she gets to interweave her passions for art and math, science and code to help bring Pixar’s fantastical world to life. Join Danielle as she takes you behind the scenes of Finding Nemo, Brave, WALL•E, Coco and more to discover how the things you imagine can become real.
contents.title: The Art of Science: Bringing Pixar’s Imagined Worlds to Life

contents.description:
Reserve time in our fully outfitted studio to record the latest episode of your audio podcast, right here at WWDC. Each 60 minute session can accommodate up to four contributors, with Apple experts on hand to help get your session up and running. You will receive a copy of your session for post-production and distribution.

Appointment requests are accepted starting at 7:00 a.m. for that day only. Apple Podcasts Studio appointments are limited to one per person for the duration of the conference.
contents.title: Apple Podcasts Studio

contents.description: Engineers from Apple’s Notifications and APNs teams will be on hand to answer your questions about Local and Remote Notifications, Content Extensions, Today Widgets and the new Notification features in iOS 12.
contents.title: Notifications Lab

contents.description: 2018 Platforms State of the Union
contents.title: Platforms State of the Union

contents.description: Step deeper into Dark Mode adoption in your macOS application. Learn about the powerful Cocoa technologies at the core of Dark Mode, and take a detailed look at the APIs and best practices for adapting to this beautiful new look.
contents.title: Advanced Dark Mode

contents.description: A lot can go wrong when loading data into your app. Whether you work directly with JSON and property lists, or with higher-level APIs such as NSCoding and Codable, learn how to defend your customers and secure your code against invalid or malicious data. Avoid fatal assumptions by validating payload structure, type information and domain correctness, to turn the data you work with into data you can trust.
contents.title: Data You Can Trust

contents.description: Apple is on a mission to advance the state of Mac security, and we want your apps to be there with us. Learn about new protections for user data, new capabilities with Developer ID, and how you can best secure your apps.
contents.title: Your Apps and the Future of macOS Security

contents.description: Get a fresh look at the HomeKit APIs. Understand how Siri and the Apple Home App use Action Sets and Accessory Services & Characteristics to provide a great home automation experience.
contents.title: HomeKit Deep Dive

contents.description: With TVMLKit you can quickly and easily develop tvOS apps that deliver intuitive and engaging media experiences. Learn about enhancements to data binding that allow you to separate your application logic and user interface, and new features and functions to customize the media playback experience.
contents.title: What's New in TVMLKit

contents.description: Learn what Apple has been doing to help your app get the most out of the network with the least effort. Let Apple’s networking APIs do the heavy lifting for you. Learn best practices for getting top networking performance from your app using the URLSession APIs.
contents.title: Optimizing Your App for Today’s Internet

contents.description: MusicKit has enabled the creation of new, compelling, and engaging Apple Music powered app experiences. With the introduction of MusicKit on the web, as a developer, you can now bring Apple Music powered experiences to the web. Learn how to use declarative markup or javascript to enable Apple Music on your website.
contents.title: MusicKit on the Web

contents.description: Engineers from Apple’s networking teams will be on hand to answer your questions, give you expert advice, and help you optimize the performance of your networking code. Bring your questions about URLSession, the new Network framework, and lower level network APIs.
contents.title: Networking Lab

contents.description: Common assumptions can break when your app is used by a global audience. Learn about the many aspects of creating apps for different regions and languages. Understand how to use fonts and typography, layout techniques, and support text input so your app shines in all languages.
contents.title: Creating Apps for a Global Audience

contents.description: Hear about exciting improvements to code coverage, including how you can build your own automation on top of Xcode’s coverage reports. Learn how to dramatically speed up the execution of your tests by leveraging distributed parallel testing, new in Xcode 10.
contents.title: What's New in Testing

contents.description: Grouping the notifications your app sends helps people get more information at a glance and manage multiple notifications at once. Learn how to implement Grouped Notifications in your app.
contents.title: Using Grouped Notifications

contents.description: The tvOS SDK allows you to create and build amazing apps and games for the big screen. And with TVMLKit you can easily and quickly develop native tvOS apps with XML templates and JavaScript logic. Get one-on-one technical guidance from Apple engineers about your own apps. Bring your code and your questions.
contents.title: tvOS Lab

contents.description: Talk with Apple's expert Bluetooth engineers and learn how to improve the throughput and reliability of your Bluetooth accessories.  Discuss how your app can best use Core Bluetooth to communicate with a Bluetooth Low Energy device.
contents.title: Bluetooth Lab

contents.description: AirPlay allows you to wirelessly stream content from your iOS device or Mac to AirPlay-enabled speakers, HomePod or an Apple TV. And with AirPlay 2, you can now fill the home with multi-room audio. Learn best practices, and get one-on-one development advice and technical assistance directly from the AirPlay engineering team. Bring your code and your questions.
contents.title: AirPlay Lab

contents.description: AVFoundation is a powerful framework for all types of media operations, including capture, editing, playback, and export. AVKit is a high-level framework to create view-level services for media playback, complete with user controls, chapter navigation, and support for subtitles and closed captioning. Get one-on-one technical guidance from Apple engineers about using AVFoundation and AVKit in your apps. Bring your code and your questions.
contents.title: AVFoundation & AVKit Lab

contents.description: AVFoundation is a powerful framework for all types of media operations, including capture, editing, playback, and export. AVKit is a high-level framework to create view-level services for media playback, complete with user controls, chapter navigation, and support for subtitles and closed captioning. Get one-on-one technical guidance from Apple engineers about using AVFoundation and AVKit in your apps. Bring your code and your questions.
contents.title: AVFoundation & AVKit Lab

contents.description: Apple engineers will be on hand to review your code and answer questions about HealthKit, workouts, CareKit and ResearchKit. Any technical, code-based, or session follow-up question are fair game so don't be shy. We're here to answer your questions, help you learn about the latest development techniques and tools, and improve your code and apps.
contents.title: Health and Fitness Technologies Lab

contents.description: Talk with CloudKit engineers to understand how you can leverage the CloudKit APIs in your app and on your website. Get advice on how to model your data, save and query records, subscribe to updates, create custom record zones, and share your records with other users. Talk to Apple experts about how to make the most of all the iCloud technologies. Bring all your CloudKit and iCloud questions, your laptop, and your code.
contents.title: iCloud and CloudKit Lab

contents.description: AppKit and Foundation are some of the building blocks for your macOS apps. Bring your laptop and your code and work with Apple engineers to resolve your AppKit and Foundation issues and answer your questions.
contents.title: Cocoa Lab

contents.description: Whether you use web content in your app via an embedded WebKit view, deliver pure web apps, or create web content to be embedded by others, it's important to ensure that you are using the most current web security standards. Learn techniques like such as special cookie attributes and HTTP response headers designed to secure your web content against the latest threats that include cross-site scripting, cross-site request forgeries, and speculative execution attacks, commonly known as Spectre.
contents.title: Strategies for Securing Web Content

contents.description: Apple engineers will be on hand to review your code and answer questions about HealthKit, workouts, CareKit and ResearchKit. Any technical, code-based, or session follow-up question are fair game so don't be shy. We're here to answer your questions, help you learn about the latest development techniques and tools, and improve your code and apps.
contents.title: Health and Fitness Technologies Lab

contents.description: Engineers from Apple’s networking teams will be on hand to answer your questions, give you expert advice, and help you optimize the performance of your networking code. Bring your questions about URLSession, the new Network framework, and lower level network APIs.
contents.title: Networking Lab

contents.description: Use Apple's accessibility APIs to deliver a seamless experience for a broad range of users. Whether you are working with VoiceOver, hearing aids, speech synthesis, or other accessibility features, be prepared to demo and fix issues in real time as you meet with Apple engineers. If you are just getting started, this is a perfect opportunity to get advice on making your app usable by everybody, regardless of their abilities.
contents.title: Accessibility Lab

contents.description: Engineers from Apple’s Security team will be on hand to answer your questions and give you expert advice on all aspects of security: protecting data on device, in transit, cryptography, authorization and authentication, and the new security features in macOS.
contents.title: Security Lab

contents.description: StoreKit Engineers and App Store Operations members will answer your questions about in-app purchases, receipt validation, subscription infrastructure, the sandbox environment, and server-side logic.
contents.title: StoreKit / Subscriptions Lab

contents.description: Get together with engineers in Apple's Core OS and Kernel team to ask your questions and get expert advice on GCD, XPC, IOKit, kext and other low-level system services.
contents.title: Kernel & Runtime Lab

contents.description: Meet the engineers from Apple’s Machine Learning teams for expert advice and answers to your questions about Create ML, Core ML, model converters, Turi Create and other tools.
contents.title: Machine Learning Lab

contents.description: Questions about, or problems with, installing the new seeds of iOS, macOS, tvOS or watchOS? Bring your devices to the lab where the Installer team will be on hand to help you.
contents.title: Installer Lab

contents.description: Are your apps designed and implemented to protect the personal information of your users? Meet Apple’s Privacy engineering team, for answers and expert guidance.
contents.title: Privacy Lab

contents.description: HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) is used to stream live and on-demand content to global audiences. Discover how to adjust and tune stream authoring and delivery elements to improve the viewing experience. Learn how to accurately measure your streaming performance, identify optimization opportunities, and implement changes to your HLS streams that can significantly improve the user experience.
contents.title: Measuring and Optimizing HLS Performance

contents.description: Engineers from Apple’s Notifications and APNs teams will be on hand to answer your questions about Local and Remote Notifications, Content Extensions, Today Widgets and the new Notification features in iOS 12.
contents.title: Notifications Lab

contents.description: Meet the engineers from Apple’s Machine Learning teams for expert advice and answers to your questions about Create ML, Core ML, model converters, Turi Create and other tools.
contents.title: Machine Learning Lab

contents.description: Gain insights into the latest in Cocoa frameworks for macOS. Hear about Dark Mode, control tinting, contextual workflows for Touch Bar and Finder, and other improvements in AppKit, Foundation, and related areas. Get an overview and guide to the sessions that we have this year covering advancements in Cocoa.
contents.title: What's New in Cocoa for macOS

contents.description: Engineers from Apple’s Notifications and APNs teams will be on hand to answer your questions about Local and Remote Notifications, Content Extensions, Today Widgets and the new Notification features in iOS 12.
contents.title: Notifications Lab

contents.description: Podcasts are created and enjoyed by millions of people around the world. With the addition of Podcast Analytics, podcasters can gather actionable and insightful intelligence into how their show is consumed, while respecting the privacy of their listeners. Learn how to interpret and use these new analytics to improve your show.
contents.title: Introducing Podcast Analytics

contents.description: Meet the Core Image engineers at this lab that follows the exciting session on Core Image Performance, Prototyping, and Python. The team will be happy to answer any questions you have on getting optimal performance in Core Image including creating CIKernels using the Metal Shading Language. It is also the perfect opportunity to get help with bugs you may be encountering in your app, so come prepared with your source code and demos.
contents.title: Core Image Lab

contents.description: Get together with the Wallet and Apple Pay engineering and business teams for expert advice on creating great user experiences using passes. Discuss Apple Pay in your apps and your websites, and how to integrate the latest features. Engineers from Apple's NFC team will also be on hand to answer your questions about the Core NFC framework.
contents.title: Wallet, Apple Pay, and Core NFC Lab

contents.description: Speech can enhance the audio experience of your app, whether you are generating spoken feedback for accessibility, or providing critical information beyond simple alerts or notifications. AVSpeechSynthesizer produces synthesized speech from text and allows you to control and monitor the progress of ongoing speech. Learn the ins and outs of AVSpeechSynthesizer and how to add computer-generated speech output to your app.
contents.title: AVSpeechSynthesizer: Making iOS Talk

contents.description: Get together with engineers in Apple's Core OS and Kernel team to ask your questions and get expert advice on GCD, XPC, IOKit, kext and other low-level system services.
contents.title: Kernel & Runtime Lab

contents.description: Drag and Drop is a powerful API that allows apps to share and communicate data. No matter how you decide to implement Drag and Drop, there's a way to make it work for people with accessibility needs. Learn the details as we dive into accessible Drag and Drop for iOS.
contents.title: Accessible Drag and Drop

contents.description: Meet with the Maps and Location engineers to discuss how you can embed new MapKit JS maps on your website and integrate MapKit and CoreLocation framework APIs in your app. Get details and advice on native and web map features and best practices for providing location-based features in a power efficient and privacy conscious manner.
contents.title: Mapping and Location Technologies Lab

contents.description: Introduced just one year ago, Core ML has already revolutionized the way apps can benefit from machine learning, by enabling fast and private on device machine learning features for your app. Find out how new Core ML features let you reduce the size of models, make them more flexible, and dramatically improve performance.
